meanings.definition: Droopiest: superlative form of droopy, meaning hanging or sagging downward
meanings.sent1: The flower with the droopiest petals looked like it was bowing.
meanings.sent2: The old dog had the droopiest ears in the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The droopiest tree branch seemed to be waving goodbye to the passing birds.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were the droopiest they had ever been, like a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The droopiest clouds hung low in the sky, heavy with rain.

meanings.definition: Droopiest: comparative form of droopy, meaning showing a lack of energy or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, she felt the droopiest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent2: The students in the last class of the day always seemed the droopiest.
meanings.sent3: Even the droopiest plant in the garden perked up after a good watering.
meanings.sent4: His shoulders slumped, making him look even droopier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The droopiest balloon at the party was barely floating above the ground.
